intro: Polygonum abbreviatum, commonly known as dwarf knotweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, with slender, upright stems that are often reddish in color. The plant features small, heart-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences and are usually pink or purplish in color. Polygonum abbreviatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors.
